With the Add Sliders feature, you can quickly create a slider deck by adding, removing, or rearranging slides ‚Äî all inside your dot workspace. Each slide can hold its own visuals, notes, and annotations, making your explanation clearer and more structured. 

## üìù  How to Add a Slider

#### Method 1: Upload Files

üìÇ Navigate to the dot where you want to build your slider.

‚¨ÜÔ∏è Select the Upload icon to add files from your device.

üì• Each uploaded file becomes its own slide automatically.

üîß Add annotations, rearrange slides, or rename the slider as needed.

<div class="relative box-content w-full max-h-[80vh] aspect-[1.90476] py-10">
  <iframe
    src="https://app.supademo.com/embed/cmjisfhm1367q3zz2uic88o45?embed_v=2&utm_source=embed"
    loading="lazy"
    title="Sign In to DOT"
    allow="clipboard-write"
    frameborder="0"
    webkitallowfullscreen="true"
    mozallowfullscreen="true"
    allowfullscreen
    class="absolute top-0 left-0 w-full h-full"
  ></iframe>
</div>

#### Method 2: Capture New Slides

üñ•Ô∏è Prepare the content you want to snapshot.

üé• Or Click the Capture button and use any of the keyboard shortcuts for faster workflow:

* Alt + S ‚Üí Capture a selected area

* Alt + A ‚Üí Capture the entire screen

* Alt + C ‚Üí Capture a specific component 

‚ö° Each capture instantly creates a new slide inside your slider.

‚úèÔ∏è Add notes, shapes, highlights, or comments to each captured slide.

<template>
  <div class="border rounded-lg shadow-md mt-4 h-60">
    <iframe src="/quickstart-capture.png" class="rounded-lg w-full h-full" scrolling="no" frameborder="0"></iframe>

  </div>
</template>

### üí° Tips

* Use uploads for polished visuals, and captures for real-time walkthroughs.

* Keep slides concise ‚Äî one idea or step per slide improves clarity.

* Mix both methods if needed: upload designed assets and capture real screens.

* Reorder slides to adjust the flow of your explanation or presentation.

* Name your slider clearly to make it easy to locate and share later.
